Posts.Content: mbf wrote: Hi, I had my last TC chemo mid-August, continue to get Herceptin every 3 weeks, and am taking Tamoxifen.  I've noticed over the last week that I've developed a pins and needles feeling in my right thumb, index, and middle finger.  Could this be some kind of neuropathy, and could it be from the chemo, or related to the tamoxifen?  I don't feel it in my feet at all, and only notice it off and on in my left thumb and index finger.  I know there's nothing they can do about it, but it's really bugging me today! Dx 4/19/2012, IDC, Left, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Surgery 5/17/2012 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Targeted Therapy 6/14/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 6/14/2012 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 9/4/2012 Breast Hormonal Therapy 9/21/2012 Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Neuropathy After Chemo??? mbf BilateralBeauties

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2013 03:26PM mbf wrote: Hi Michelles66 - wondering if you're doing any better since your post.  Sorry for not replying sooner - I haven't been on the boards lately I guess just because I'm in some sort of funk :(   Anyway, I do hope you are feeling better or have at least been able to get some answers or help.  Have you? Linda-n3 - Thanks so much for the info.  I'm still having the same feeling in those three fingers in both my hands, but my oncologist didn't seem at all concerned.  I can deal with it, and considering all the rest of the "stuff" I'm feeling due to tamoxifen, etc., I guess I just figure it's minor in comparison.  Is it wrong to assume that since it seems minor, it will eventually lessen and go away?
Posts.Title: Neuropathy After Chemo??? mbf BilateralBeauties
